docs.snippet: In Thursday’s Game 4 of the N.B.A. finals, the Heat’s offense was dispirited and disorganized, and their defense invariably left open a member of the Spurs....
docs.lead_paragraph: In Thursday’s Game 4 of the N.B.A. finals, the Heat’s offense was dispirited and disorganized, and their defense invariably left open a member of the Spurs.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports Of The Times column dissects Miami Heat's loss to the San Antonio Spurs in Game 4 of the NBA finals; argues that team, marked by a dispirited and disorganized offense, is finally learning the lesson of defeat at the hands of the sensational Spurs.

headline.seo: Miami Heat Are Blown Out by San Antonio Spurs in Game 4 of N.B.A. Finals
headline.print_headline: Miami Discovers What Defeat Looks Like

headline.main: New Challenge for Metta World Peace

docs.snippet: The N.B.A. finals have been shockingly one-sided, with the Spurs relying on lethal shooting and talented role players to put the defending champion Heat on the verge of being dethroned....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.B.A. finals have been shockingly one-sided, with the Spurs relying on lethal shooting and talented role players to put the defending champion Heat on the verge of being dethroned.
docs.abstract: Analysis; NBA finals have emerged as shockingly one-sided, with defending champion Miami Heat succumbing rapidly to a lethal performance from the San Antonio Spurs; key aspect seems to be how the Spurs have exploited weaknesses in the Heat's defense, consistently creating room for open shots.

headline.main: Spurs Have Made N.B.A. Finals Anything but Close
headline.print_headline: Spurs Have Made It Anything but Close

docs.snippet: Miami’s Big Three can all opt out of their contracts, and at least two of them — LeBron James and Chris Bosh — might be considering it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Miami’s Big Three can all opt out of their contracts, and at least two of them — LeBron James and Chris Bosh — might be considering it.
docs.abstract: Miami Heat, struggling to survive in the NBA finals amid strong showing from the San Antonio Spurs, also face an uncertain long-term future; team's three star players, LeBron James, Chris Bosh and Dwayne Wade, are all eligible to become free agents in coming season; James and Bosh have both given subtle signs that a team change may be in the offing.

headline.main: After Heat’s Humbling Loss, Future Is Uncertain
headline.print_headline: After Heat’s Humbling Loss, Future Is Uncertain

docs.snippet: Chris McDaniel sees David Brat’s unlikely primary defeat of House Leader Eric Cantor as a springboard to victory over longtime incumbent Thad Cochran....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chris McDaniel sees David Brat’s unlikely primary defeat of House Leader Eric Cantor as a springboard to victory over longtime incumbent Thad Cochran.
docs.abstract: Defeat of Rep Eric Cantor in Virginia primary is energizing backers of Mississippi State Sen Chris McDaniel, Tea Party-backed candidate who has upended state's Republican order by forcing Sen Thad Cochran into a runoff; conservative groups are intensifying their activity in Mississippi, where McDaniel has done well with connecting to voters among whom suspicion of Washington runs deep.

headline.seo: Chris McDaniel Works to Topple Thad Cochran
headline.main: Upset Fueling Tea Party Hope in Senate Race
headline.print_headline: Upset Fueling Tea Party Hope in Senate Race
